1: If there is therefore any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from his love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions,
2: make my joy full so that you are of the same mind, have the same love, are united in spirit, and have the same purpose.
3: Do nothing through selfishness or empty pride, but instead in lowliness of mind count others better than yourself.
4: Do not look out for each of your own needs, but also look out for the needs of others.
5: Have this mind in you, which was also in Christ Jesus, \q
6: who existed in the form of God. \q2 He did not consider his equality with God  \q3 as something to hold on to. \q
7: But instead he emptied himself. \q2 He took the form of a servant. \q2 He appeared in the likeness of men. \q  He was found in appearance as a man. \q2
8: He humbled himself and obeyed to the point of death,  \q2   even the death of the cross.
9: Therefore also God highly exalted him,  \q2 and gave him the name above every name. \q
10: So at the name of Jesus every knee should bow,  \q2 of those in heaven and on earth and under the earth. \q
11: And every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord,  \q2 to the glory of God the Father.
12: So then, my beloved, even as you always obey, not only in my presence but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
13: For it is God who works in you both to will and to work for his good pleasure.
14: Do everything without complaining and arguing,
15: so that you may become blameless and honest children of God without blemish, and shine as lights in the world in the middle of a crooked and depraved generation.
16: Hold tightly to the word of life so that I may have reason to glory in the day of Christ, because then I will know that I did not run in vain nor labor in vain.
17: But even if my life is poured out as an offering upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice with great joy with you all.
18: And in the same manner you also must rejoice with great joy with me.
19: But I expect in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, that his report may also encourage me when I know how you are doing.
20: I have no one like Timothy who will truly care for you.
21: For they all seek their own interests, not the things of Jesus Christ.
22: But you know Timothy has proven himself, because, as a child serves his father, so he served with me in the spread of the gospel.
23: Therefore I expect to send him as soon as I see how things will go with me.
24: But I am confident in the Lord that I myself will come soon, also.
25: I think it necessary to send you back Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow worker and fellow soldier, and your messenger and minister to my need.
26: Because you heard he was sick, he was deeply distressed and longed to be with you all.
27: For indeed he was so sick he almost died, but God had mercy on him. And not on him only, but also on me that I might not have sorrow upon sorrow.
28: Therefore I am eager to send him so that when you see him again you may rejoice and I will not worry so much.
29: Welcome Epaphroditus in the Lord with all joy and honor him as people like him deserve,
30: because he almost died doing the work of Christ, as he risked his life to serve me and supply my needs, in place of you who could not do it.
